description: You are given a directed graph of n nodes numbered from 0 to n - 1, where each node has at most one outgoing edge. The graph is represented with a given 0-indexed array edges of size n, indicating that there is a directed edge from node i to node edges[i]. If there is no outgoing edge from node i, then edges[i] == -1. Return the length of the longest cycle in the graph. If no cycle exists, return -1. A cycle is a path that starts and ends at the same node.
